titleStmt.title: A letter, giving a descripton of the Isthmus of Darian (where the Scot's colonie is settled;) from a gentleman who lives there at present. With an account of the fertility of the soil, the quality of the air, the manners of the inhabitants, and the nature of the plants, and animals. &c. And a particular mapp of the Isthmus, and entrance to the river of Darian.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for John Mackie, in the Parliament-Closs [sic], and James Wardlaw on the north side of the street a little below the Cross, at the sign of the Bible,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the north side of the street a little below the Cross, at the sign of the Bible
